Pre-Game Insights: India and Ireland are set to clash in the upcoming 2024 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York on June 5th.
India, led by captain Rohit Sharma, boasts a formidable lineup with explosive opening duo of Sharma and Virat Kohli, supported by Suryakumar Yadav and Rishabh Pant in the middle order.
The bowling attack for India is spearheaded by Jasprit Bumrah, supported by Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, and Ravindra Jadeja.
Ireland, captained by Paul Stirling, relies heavily on their opening pair of Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie to provide solid starts.
In the bowling department for Ireland, the onus will be on Joshua Little and Craig Young to pick up crucial wickets, with support from Mark Adair, Barry McCarthy, and others.
India and Ireland have faced each other only once in a T20 World Cup match during the 2nd edition in 2009, where India emerged victorious by defeating Ireland with 8 wickets at Nottingham in England.
Players to watch for India include Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, and Ravindra Jadeja.
Players to watch for Ireland include Paul Stirling, Andrew Balbirnie, and Joshua Little.

The Nassau County International Cricket Stadium pitch offers equitable opportunities for both pace bowlers and batsmen, with early assistance for fast bowlers and more conducive conditions for batting as the match progresses.
